import pandas as pd
from scipy.stats import rankdata
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pylab as plt
source.e1f84f2c:
sub98 = pd.read_csv('../input/seti-lb0980/submission.csv')
sub98_v1 = pd.read_csv('../input/seti-lb-098-v1/submission.csv')
sub98_v2 = pd.read_csv('../input/seti-lb-098-v2/submission.csv')
sub99 = pd.read_csv('../input/seti-lb-0991/submission.csv')
sub97 = pd.read_csv('../input/seti-0975/submission.csv')

sub98 = sub98.set_index(['id'])
sub98_v1 = sub98_v1.set_index(['id'])
sub98_v2 = sub98_v2.set_index(['id'])

sub99 = sub99.set_index(['id'])
sub97 = sub97.set_index(['id'])
source.6b201cec:
subs = [sub98, sub98_v1, sub98_v2, sub99, sub97]

for s in subs:
    s['target'] = rankdata(s['target'].values) / s.shape[0]
    
sub98['target'] = 0.025*sub98['target'].values + 0.10*sub99.loc[sub98.index, 'target'].values + 0.025*sub97.loc[sub98.index, 'target'].values + 0.025sub98_v1.loc[sub98.index, 'target'].values+0.825*sub98_v2.loc[sub98.index, 'target'].values
0
sub98['target'].hist()
plt.show()

sub98.to_csv('submission.csv')
